children.subject: the skills would help I'm not sure about the degree name

history.content: Given that you're doing EECS, you don't need to double in DS. What's going to help way more than the undergrad Data Science degree is your Master's degree in a technical field, especially with it being a reputable degree if you're doing your 5th year masters at Cal too. Make sure to utilize the data science courses here at Cal and apply that knowledge towards a self project or internship. That knowledge and experience combined with that MS will overshadow your undergrad degree

I am a rising EECS sophomore with IGETC (equivalent to completing all L&S breadths). I am interested in becoming a ML engineer or Data Scientist after completing the 5th year master's program here at Cal. Declaring a simultaneous degree in Data Science will give me priority in Data C102, add Math 104 to my schedule (I may take the class anyways because I heard it helps with ML research), but also require me to take one of my upper-div HSS classes for a letter grade (for the DS ethics requirement). Is it worth it to declare a simultaneous degree? Will the extra degree help if I look for data scientist positions after my master's degree? Thanks!
history.subject: Worth it to double in DS?
